snippet: The main banking regulator said it discovered that from 2006 to 2009, about 100 internal chat messages trying to rig the interest rate had been sent by UBS traders to the employee who was responsible for making submissions on the bank’s behalf.
abstract: The main banking regulator said it discovered that from 2006 to 2009, about 100 internal chat messages trying to rig the interest rate had been sent by UBS traders to the employee who was responsible for making submissions on the bank’s behalf.

headline.main: UBS Tried to Rig Interest Rate, Hong Kong Regulator Finds
